item.title: [Oracle] Converting a Non-Partitioned Table to a Partitioned Table
item.description: A non-partitioned table can be converted to a partitioned table with a MODIFY clause added to the ALTER TABLE SQL statement. In addition, the keyword ONLINE can be specified, enabling concurrent DML operations while conversion in ongoing. Conversion to a monthly range-partitioned table from today using the ONLINE keyword. ALTER TABLE table_name MODIFY PARTITION BY RANGE (date_column) INTERVAL (numtoyminterval(1,'MONTH')) (PARTITION table_name_p1 VALUES LESS THAN (TO_DATE('22-MAR-2022','DD-MON-YYYY'))) ONLINE;

item.title: [Oracle] Partition Table
item.description: Create a monthly range-partitioned table starting from today. CREATE TABLE table_name ( ... date_column timestamp(6) ) PARTITION BY RANGE (date_column) INTERVAL (numtoyminterval(1,'MONTH')) (PARTITION table_name_p1 VALUES LESS THAN (TO_DATE('12-MAR-2022','DD-MON-YYYY'))); Additional: You need numtodsinterval(1,‘DAY’) if you want to partition by day.
